subject: Technology
title: Bionic Eyes: Restoring Sight
description: A quick win: understand Bionic Eyes: Restoring Sight.

hook.text: Glasses with a camera send images to electrodes on the retina. Blind patients see shapes and light for the first time in decades.

buildup.text: The Argus II retinal prosthesis was the first bionic eye approved for human use. It gives a very basic form of vision.

discovery.text: Patients see flashes of light that outline shapes and movement. It's not normal vision, but it's enough to navigate a room.

twist.text: Second Sight, the Argus II maker, went bankrupt. Patients with implants were left with devices no one can service or update.

climax.text: The lesson is sobering: when your medical device is made by a company, your health depends on that company's survival.

punchline.text: We build bionic eyes. No one guarantees the company survives to maintain them.

quiz.question: What happened to patients with Argus II bionic eyes?
options: The manufacturer went bankrupt, leaving devices without support
The implants were replaced with newer models
